question.title: iText 7 Footer new Canvas(..).close() gives "Resource leak: '<unassigned Closeable value>' is never closed"
question.body:
I'm following this iText 7 Footer Example, almost unmodified, to add a footer to the PDF: https://kb.itextpdf.com/itext/page-events-for-headers-and-footers

There is an Event Handler defined which uses a Canvas,

@Override
public void handleEvent(Event event) {
    PdfDocumentEvent docEvent = (PdfDocumentEvent) event;
    PdfDocument pdfDoc = docEvent.getDocument();
    PdfPage page = docEvent.getPage();
    
    String footerContent = "My Footer";
    Paragraph footerParagraph = new Paragraph(footerContent);
    
    PdfCanvas canvas = new PdfCanvas(page.newContentStreamBefore(), page.getResources(), pdfDoc);

    new Canvas(canvas, new Rectangle(36, 20, page.getPageSize().getWidth() - 72, 50))
            .add(footerParagraph)
            .close();
    
}

I'm getting a warning on their line new Canvas(canvas, new Rectangle(... :

Resource leak: <unassigned Closeable value> is never closed

For reference, here are their classes:

https://api.itextpdf.com/iText/java/7.2.4/com/itextpdf/layout/Canvas.html - the Canvas class causing this issue

https://api.itextpdf.com/iText/java/7.2.0/index.html?com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/canvas/PdfCanvas.html

https://api.itextpdf.com/iText5/java/latest/com/itextpdf/text/Rectangle.html
